intro: Shortia exappendiculata var. transalpina, commonly known as the Transalpine Shortia, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the Appalachian Mountains. It is characterized by its small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and has lance-shaped leaves with a waxy surface. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is known for its unique floral structure and limited distribution. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered in many areas.
